聞.definition: to hear; news; well-known; famous; reputation; fame; to smell; to sniff at

聞一多.definition: Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming

聞一知十.definition: lit. to hear one and know ten (idiom); fig. explain one thing and (he) understands everything; a word to the wise

聞上去.definition: to smell of sth; to smell like sth

聞出.definition: to identify by smell; to detect a scent; to sniff out

聞到.definition: to smell; to sniff sth out; to perceive by smelling

聞名不如見面.pinyin: wén míng bù rú jiàn miàn
聞名不如見面.definition: knowing sb by their reputation can't compare to meeting them in person (idiom)

聞名遐邇.definition: (idiom) to be famous far and wide

聞喜.definition: Wenxi county in Yuncheng 運城|运城[Yun4 cheng2], Shanxi

聞喜縣.definition: Wenxi county in Yuncheng 運城|运城[Yun4 cheng2], Shanxi

聞所未聞.definition: unheard of; an extremely rare and unprecedented event

聞見.definition: to smell; to hear; knowledge; information

聞言.definition: to have heard what was said

聞診.definition: (TCM) auscultation and smelling, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]

聞過則喜.definition: to accept criticism gladly (humble expr.); to be happy when one's errors are pointed out

聞雞起舞.definition: to start practicing at the first crow of the cock (idiom); to be diligent in one's studies

聞風先遁.definition: to flee at hearing the news (idiom)

聞風喪膽.definition: hear the wind and lose gall (idiom); terror-stricken at the news

聞風而動.definition: to respond instantly; to act at once on hearing the news
